                            Double centery,
                            Double range)
        Given a point and a range, retrieves all the obstacles within.
        Parameters:
        centerx - the x coordinate of the center
        centery - the y coordinate of the center
        range - the range to scan
        Returns:
        the list of Obstacles

      • hasMobileObstacles

        boolean hasMobileObstacles()
        Returns:
        true if this environment has mobile obstacles obstacles, false if the obstacles are static

      • intersectsObstacle

        boolean intersectsObstacle(double sx,
                           double sy,
                           double ex,
                           double ey)
        Checks whether there is at least an obstacle intersecting the line connecting [sx, sy] and [ex, ey].
        Parameters:
        sx - start x
        sy - start y
        ex - end x
        ey - end y
        Returns:
        true if the line connecting [sx, sy] and [ex, ey] touches an obstacle

      • intersectsObstacle

        boolean intersectsObstacle(IPosition p1,
                           IPosition p2)
        Checks whether there is at least an obstacle intersecting the line connecting p1 and p2.
        Parameters:
        p1 - start position
        p2 - end position
        Returns:
        true if the line connecting p1 and p2 touches an obstacle

      • next

        IPosition next(double ox,
               double oy,
               double nx,
               double ny)
        This method must calculate the RELATIVE next allowed position given the current position and the position in which the node wants to move. For example, if your node is in position [2,3], wants to move to [3,4] but the next allowed position (because, e.g., of physical obstacles) is [2.5,3.5], the result must be a IPosition containing coordinates [0.5,0.5], so it's the relative movement considering the starting position as origin.
        Parameters:
        ox - The current X position
        oy - The current Y position
        nx - The requested X position
        ny - The requested Y position
        Returns:
        the next allowed position, where the node can actually move. This position MUST be considered as a vector whose start point is in [ox, oy].

      • removeObstacle

        boolean removeObstacle(W o)
        Removes an IObstacle2D from this environment.
        Parameters:
        o - the IObstacle2D to add
        Returns:
        true if the IObstacle2D has actually been removed
